items.sentence: Were you the one who advised Tom to go to the police?
What do you think is the most popular sport in Japan?
What makes you think we should buy something for Tom?
When Tom stopped for a stop sign, his engine stalled.
Have you visited the town where your father was born?
He finally realized that Mary had made a fool of him.
He gave me an orange in exchange for a piece of cake.
They were very tired, hungry, and thirsty that night.
To tell the truth, I forgot all about your questions.
Tom and Mary tried to keep their relationship secret.
He\'s been staying at that hotel since five days ago.
How has your life been different than your father\'s?
You do know who Tom\'s French teacher is, don\'t you?
You don\'t have to do anything you don\'t want to do.
I don\'t have enough money to pay this month\'s rent.
I don\'t know if I\'ll be able to help you on Monday.
I don\'t know whether he\'ll come by train or by car.
Tom said that he didn\'t want to go to Mary\'s party.
Tom left for Boston as soon as he got Mary\'s letter.
Once you\'ve said something, it can\'t be taken back.
